page.title: 04 NORTH STAINLEY GARAGE
page.content: Tom Park, a blacksmith, bought the premises in 1907. In the 1920's he sold "Pratt's Petrol" in square ,2 gallon tins and owned his first car which he used as a taxi in North Stainley and Mickley. Then in the 1930's the first hand operated petrol pump was fitted. In 1943 Tom began to do car repairs and his blacksmith trade deteriorated. Two years later he took his son-in -law Bert Maddison into partnership which ended in 1970 when Bert died.Bill Stockhill and Jim Catford bought the business and by 1979 they had built a new workshop and added petrol pumps and a forecourt. At present they are Citroen service dealers but they will do general repairs to all types of vehicles. They are open from 7.30 am until 6.00 pm.
